subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] if symbols that are 180 degree similar are confusing then shouldn't Quickscript/
msgSnippet: They re not *that* confusing.  The only one s I ve ever found troubling are the four vowels that are all 90 degrees similiar. Yours, alex ...
messageBody:
They're not *that* confusing. The only one's I've
ever found troubling are the four vowels that are all
90 degrees similiar.

Yours,

alex

--- satnordameriko <satnordameriko@...> wrote:

> Read create new symbols. From my understand the
> problems with
> symbols that are similar is a big problem for
> dyslexics and/or for
> folks trying to learn a new writing system.
>
> thanks for answering. I think now I understand that
> the Read
> Alphabet particularly it's junior version offers all
> the advantages
> of Shavian without (as many at least) it's problems.
>
> Having a computer keyboard that could type
> Read/Quikscript would be
> great along with some type of interactive "course"
> on a website
> (with soundfiles/pictures/flash cards/et. al).
>
> Thanks.
>
> Jesse Heiwa
> for an international auxilliary language
> www.Esperanto.net
>
> for a phonemic? writing system for global English
> The Read/Quikscript system
>
> anyone else in NYC area?
>
>

They're not *that* confusing.  The only one's I've
ever found troubling are the four vowels that are all
90 degrees similiar.  

Yours,

alex
